_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies.This facility complies with  state and federal regulations relating to storage of anhydrous ammonia. If an emergency were to occurr, it is our policy to notify the Region 3 Emergency Planning District and ask that they respond. Osceola County contact is Marian Roetzel at Osceola Emergency Management Agency, Courthouse,Sibley IA 51249.Office phone 712-754-2381,24 hour phone 712-754-2556(Sheriff's Office).

Description of facility and regulated substance. This facility is a farm supply cooperative. The anhydrous ammonia is used by farm producers as plant food for corn production. It is stored in a 26,000 gallon storage tank and in 1000 gallon mobile nurse tanks for farm use.

Worse-case release scenario. Our worst case scenario is the 26,000 tank filled to 85% releasing anhydrous ammonia through a failure of the tank. According to the EPA look up tables the area affected is an urban area 4.4miles in distance from our facility. The population affected is 1787 from census data.

General accidental release prevention program and anhydrous ammonia prevention steps. This facility complies with state and local regulations. The plant is inspected by the Iowa Department of Agriculture and Farmland Insurance on an annual basis. The tanks are maintained by CEA personel.

Five-year accident history. We have never had an accident involving ammonia that caused deaths or injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations or shelterings in place.

Emergency Response Program. In the event of an emergency involving our anhydrous ammmonia system, it is our policy to notify the Region 3 Planning District and request they respond to the emergency. Marion Roetzel is the local contact at the Osceola Emergency Management Agency, Courthouse,Sibley Iowa 51249. The phone is 712-754-2381 office or 24 hour 712-754-2556(Sheriff's Office).

There are no planned safety changes.
